metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: "async and await make promises easier to write"
content.html: "async and await make promises easier to write"

content.text: async makes a function return a Promise
content.html: async makes a function return a Promise

content.text: await makes a function wait for a Promise
content.html: await makes a function wait for a Promise

content.text: The keyword async before a function makes the function return a promise:
content.html: The keyword async before a function makes the function return a promise:

content.code_html:
async function myFunction() {
  return "Hello";
}

content.text: Here is how to use the Promise:
content.html: Here is how to use the Promise:

content.code_html:
myFunction().then(
  function(value) { /* code if successful */ },
  function(error) { /* code if some error */ }
);

async function myFunction() {
  return "Hello";
}
myFunction().then(
  function(value) {myDisplayer(value);},
  function(error) {myDisplayer(error);}
);

content.text: Or simpler, since you expect a normal value (a normal response, not an error):
content.html: Or simpler, since you expect a normal value (a normal response, not an error):

content.code_html:
async function myFunction() {
  return "Hello";
}
myFunction().then(
  function(value) {myDisplayer(value);}
);

content.text: The await keyword can only be used inside an async function.
content.html: The await keyword can only be used inside an async function.

content.text: The await keyword makes the function pause the execution and wait for a resolved promise before it continues:
content.html: The await keyword makes the function pause the execution and wait for a resolved promise before it continues:

content.code_html: let value = await promise;

content.text: Let's go slowly and learn how to use it.
content.html: Let's go slowly and learn how to use it.

content.code_html:
async function myDisplay() {
  let myPromise = new Promise(function(resolve, reject) {
    resolve("I love You !!");
  });
  document.getElementById("demo").innerHTML = await myPromise;
}

myDisplay();

content.text: The two arguments (resolve and reject) are pre-defined by JavaScript.
content.html: The two arguments (resolve and reject) are pre-defined by JavaScript.

content.text: We will not create them, but call one of them when the executor function is ready.
content.html: We will not create them, but call one of them when the executor function is ready.

content.text: Very often we will not need a reject function.
content.html: Very often we will not need a reject function.

content.code_html:
async function myDisplay() {
  let myPromise = new Promise(function(resolve) {
    resolve("I love You !!");
  });
  document.getElementById("demo").innerHTML = await myPromise;
}

myDisplay();

async function myDisplay() {
  let myPromise = new Promise(function(resolve) {
    setTimeout(function() {resolve("I love You !!");}, 3000);
  });
  document.getElementById("demo").innerHTML = await myPromise;
}

myDisplay();

async function getFile() {
  let myPromise = new Promise(function(resolve) {
    let req = new XMLHttpRequest();
    req.open('GET', "mycar.html");
    req.onload = function() {
      if (req.status == 200) {
        resolve(req.response);
      } else {
        resolve("File not Found");
      }
    };
    req.send();
  });
  document.getElementById("demo").innerHTML = await myPromise;
}

getFile();

content.text: ECMAScript 2017 introduced the JavaScript keywords async and await .
The following table defines the first browser version with full support for both:
content.html: The following table defines the first browser version with full support for both:

content.code_html:
Chrome 55 Edge 15 Firefox 52 Safari 11 Opera 42
Dec, 2016 Apr, 2017 Mar, 2017 Sep, 2017 Dec, 2016
